main event: A bright, pulsating light was observed by two witnesses while driving north on Route 66 in Fairfax County, Virginia on February 7, 1969.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be 5 to 10 miles distant and approximately 1 1/2 times the apparent diameter of the full moon.
The light had a pulsating or flashing quality, alternating between a very bright white light and a dimmer reddish-orange light at a rate of about 1 pulse per second.
The light did not appear to be moving and suddenly disappeared after 2 to 3 minutes of observation.
The witnesses were a mechanical engineer and an electronic technician with the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, who had some interest and experience in astronomy and aircraft identification.
The Air Force concluded that the sighting was likely of a Garment Bag Hot Air Balloon, based on past similar sightings.
result: concluded to be a hot air balloon
sighted object: a bright, pulsating light in the sky
